column1: #Text=Mozambican opposition rejects election results , calls for another vote
#Text=Mozambique 's main opposition party has rejected the results of last month 's national elections , alleging fraud and ballot-stuffing .
#Text=Official results were released on Wednesday confirming that President Armando Guebuza had won another term in office .
#Text=The secretary-general of the opposition Renamo Party , Ussufo Momade , announced his party 's rejection of the election results , saying there had been widespread fraud .
#Text=" We do not recognize these elections , " he stated .
#Text=" We demand the cancellation of the results that were just announced and we insist on a new vote .

column1: #Text=The president 's Frelimo Party also won 191 of the 250 seats in parliament .
#Text=Before the elections , Frelimo had 160 seats and Renamo 90 .
#Text=Frelimo has been in power since 1975 , when Mozambique declared independence from Portugal .
#Text=Renamo 's candidate , Afonso Dhlakama , received 16 % of the vote , while the leader of a new party , Daviz Simango of the Mozambique Democratic Movement ( MDM ) , received 8 % .
#Text=Sixteen other parties were also in contention for parliament seats , but none of them received more than one percent of the vote .
#Text=Frelimo , which has a two-thirds majority in the parliament , has a sufficient number of seats to alter the constitution without support from other parties .
#Text=There has been some speculation that Frelimo may use this to allow Guebuza to run for a third term - currently , the constitution allows a president to serve only two terms in office .
#Text=Senior Frelimo party members , however , promised that Guebuza had no intention of seeking another term .

#Text= It is quite difficult to accept this kind of declaration because all the processes were followed [ ... ] so the process was very , very transparent and everybody was able to see what was happening , " Nice said .
